pros: Local hospital in a great area. Leadership listens to employees and very transparent
cons: Serve the Healthcare needs of a challenging community and payor mix

review_title: Not the best but, not the worst either
pros: Everyone gets along in terms of coworkers and me. It's like a family Patients are a nice part of the job. They bring joy to a sometimes negative work environment. Again not the most negative place to work
cons: Management asks for our ideas, or suggestions and nothing happens. They don't care about our suggestions. Coworkers who have been here a while(years) seem unhappy , have negative attitudes due to nothing being improved in terms of the functionality after them complaining to management or giving management their ideas.

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Southbridge, MA
pros: Flexible with vacation time. Plenty of earn time. Co workers are all very nice.
cons: The pay is lower than most hospitals.

job_title: Insurance Eligibility Representative in Webster, MA
pros: Flexible, Easy job, No micro-managing
cons: Toxic environment, lots of favoritism

review_title: Turn over in physician offices is just as bad as the pay
pros: Consistent schedule is really the only one.
cons: Don't expect to make a job with Harrington Physician Services job a career. Raises are never given. especially after merging with UMASS and inflation being so severe, you'd think they'd pay their staff more. Turn around is horrible, no one stays. Staff belittled by higher ups. Barely any training.

pros: it is a hands on learning experience.
cons:
pay is not competitive. 
they will add on tasks to your job role but do not compensate accordingly. Understaffed.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Southbridge, MA
pros: Smaller scale hospital. More personable. They work at combating a hostel environment for both employees and the public. Creating a pleasant environment to work in.
cons: Recently purchased by a larger hospital hope this doesn't change the atmosphere. But increases in training and pay would be helpful.

pros: great co workers, caring staff
cons: horrible administration that is completely out of touch with clinicians/bedside workers

pros:
Great doctor to work for. Dedicated to his patients.
Worked with him from day one of his practice, 7/1/85.
cons: There really are no cons. Got laid off because of the Covid-19 pandemic.

pros: Good people, quality pt care
cons: Too small at times but they do know when to get more help

review_title: A jem of an employer - lots of opportunity!
pros: I've been at Harrington for almost 10 years and worked in 3 different departments. That's what I love about Harrington - there's flexibility and opportunity to move up and try something new. I consistently see co-workers begin in one department and then move up to another department either by their request or because of a promotion. Harrington managers are looking for the best fit and are flexible to let employees go to a different department if that is what the desire is and the fit is good (even if they are a wonderful employee and would like to keep them!). I have had great experiences in every department I've been promoted to and I am grateful for all the opportunities I've been given at Harrington.
cons: Working in healthcare is difficult in general. Harrington is wading through the challenges well while still growing and expanding.

review_title: I've had great experiences, but not everyone has
pros: I've found the staff to be very supportive of each other.  If you work between departments this can especially be true.  I also believe that the pay has been reasonable, and at least was higher than other - yet similar - positions before I was hired a few years ago.  I've definitely gotten a good 'community hospital/clinic' feel from this organization.
cons: Upper management feels detached from much of the rest of the company.  While they will visit in-hospital locations (though infrequently) outside of special occasions I've never seen them visit off-site locations.  Being a community hospital, Harrington has also struggled financially over the last several years and this has lowered morale during those times throughout the organization.

review_title: I worked there as a Phlebotomist and I had a great experience working with so many great people.
pros: Among those who I worked are very supportive and friendly.
cons: I would say if you are experienced and worked before and know what you are doing would be easier to work there. Especially among the nurses they care about their patients and would love to see you do your job properly. It was difficult for me first time when I just started my job w/out experience. Most nurses especially ER nurses were upset when I was not able to obtain the blood but after several months getting experience they began to respect and were very friendly.

pros: This is truly a company that puts their employees first - and they understand FAMILY comes first. This healthcare organization has grown significantly over the past 5 years. Everyone should give it a second look! From an outstanding cancer center to wound care therapy and advanced surgical services like Total Joint replacement, there is good reason to choose Harrington.
cons: As often with the case of non-urban hospitals, one person does the task of 5 or 6. But it's each staff members commitment to patients and each other that make it great.

pros: Please see previous review entitled "Clinician".
cons: I have already submitted a review on Harrington however, once I saw that the Marketing Department was writing rapid fire responses to negative reviews and then suddenly several positive reviews were submitted thereafter, I had to write again. This is a pathetic and desperate attempt to get staffing because Harrington cannot hire nor keep mental health professionals. Don't believe the positive reviews, I can guarantee it's marketing employees or management trying to save face.

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Southbridge, MA
pros:
Great coworkers who help you out and want you to succeed. 
Easy to get extra hours
cons:
Break room is also a meeting room
semiannual personal feedback is done electronically
Management does not keep things confidential.

pros: Most co-workers are very dedicated and easy to work with
cons: Broken up into multiple entities (locations, clinics, etc.) the place is confusing the navigate. Management agenda varies frequently;.  Patients are largely on Medicaid and medicare and this is causing issues with inadequate reimbursements, making the outlook poor. Attempts to merge with other hospitals have not worked well.

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Southbridge, MA
pros:
Fair pay
Great people 
CEO is very personable 
Good leadership team 
Nice cafeteria 
Flexible hours 
Clean 
Committees and additional volunteer opportunities open to all departments 
Leadership team was open to feedback
Healthcare staff was educated and kind
cons: There were some people here in various departments who would complain about the workplace, but not do anything to improve it which was frustrating to me.

pros: Flexible scheduling, reasonable productivity, good salary
cons: The management team is a horrible group of people who are missing opportunities and firing employees without working to fix problems. There are so many places that are hiring.  I would not recommend this place to anyone.

job_title: Radiology Scheduler in Charlton City, MA
pros: They have a good benefit package
cons: It's clicky and mis-managed administratively.

pros: some very nice coworkers and patients
cons: Very poor management team at OBH ., poor communication, management has shown me they have no concern for the employee, especially if disabled. if you contact CEO, you will never get a response,,,and Human Resources is there for company , not you, even if you are disabled and have been treated poorly

review_title: unprofessional, unqualified mental/behavioral health senior management
job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Southbridge, MA
pros: Great supervisor and "team" members
cons: Seriously?  I only gave it one star because the "team" that I worked with were stellar.  Otherwise, I'm skeptical of anyone who has worked there over the past five years that rates it any higher than two stars.

pros: Nice atmosphere. Working conditions were great. Nice outpatient offices. Each outpatient location has diagnostic possibilities. Pay was decent considering the per diem position. Dedicated to patients.
cons: Not the most reliable office staff in certain departments. Limited amount of on the job training. Per diems are held to a different standard.

pros: staff works together to make a great patient experience , friendly atmosphere, patient centered care
cons: hourly rate is low, not much room for advancement, no union, management often changes you to a different shift or location than what you agreed to when you were hired

pros: Awesome coworkers and amazing nurse manager! And yes, this is a genuine review from an RN in the trenches.
cons: Budget concerns but that's everywhere.

pros: Nice local small healthcare services. Met some very nice and genuine employees
cons: while there were nice employees there were a fair share that were extremely rude and condescending

pros: good coworkers, decent pay if you have experience.
cons: Stuck in the past. Management does not care about you just about them selves.

review_title: Overall a great place to work
pros:
Multidisciplinary team work
Salary is above similar jobs
Great clients
Huge growth in the last few years
Continuum of care for clients
cons:
As with many companies, communication lacks at times
Caseload can be stressful at times

review_title: Current employee at the Southbridge hospital
pros: Management, company and individual growth, great benefits. Start off with 4 weeks paid time off.
cons: Company culture has gotten stronger throughout the years, but there is still room for growth.

pros: Small community Hospital makes for good pt care ratios
cons: non-level 1 trauma center. Some critical cases need to be transported to level 1 trauma centers.

pros: Chances to work on press releases and work closely with the VP of Marketing.
cons:
Only 2 interned two days a week.
Team was not very willing to develop social media presence.

review_title: Harrington Hospital is experiencing organized chaos
pros: Organizational change ongoing, colleagues supportive
cons: Salary compensation is not competitive
